Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: trace of maeander pattern around rim; below, painted decoration consisting of goat's rump, to right; part of pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to Lemos the animal depicted on the sherd might be a feline, but that is unlikely as felines are depicted with long tails and the tail on this sherd is short and pointing upwards. Lemos places this sherd within the Mature Animal Style, but the rim on the sherd more closely resembles the less elaborate Wild Goat Style rim patterns.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 266, no. 597, pl. 74)
Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 22, no. A5, pl. 2, 1)
Himmelmann & Geominy 1992 / Rheinisch-Westfälische Akademie der Wissenschaften (p. 24, fig. 4d, p. 52-3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0227) (phase 2)
